Works fine on other platforms.  Looks like an SWT problem.

Build 3.0RC1, Id 200405290105

I found a similar problem on both Solaris 9 and HPUX11.11 platforms. Here are 
the steps to recreate the issue:
- Create a plug-in project using the code generation wizard with "Hello World".
- Click on the Runtime tab of the Manifest Editor.
- Create a dummy library by clicking the Add button in the Run-time libraries 
section. Use the name 'New Library.jar'.
- Select 'New Library.jar' and from its context menu, select copy. An error 
message comes up to force me to exit the workbench.

Here is the info from the .log file:

I get this problem all the time with RC1 and RC2, eclipse-SDK-3.0RC2-win32.zip.
 I use Windows XP.  I never see it when working locally, but quite often when
over VPN and Remote Desktop (mstsc.exe).  It happens for both CTRL-C and CTRL-X,
about 80% of the time, but I don't see any pattern to when it will or will not
cause the error.

By the way, there are many duplicates of this bug, maybe as many as 15.  I found
a workaround in Bug 59459, suggesting to turn off folding, and it seems to fix
it.  However, cutting with CTRL-X does copy the selection to the clipboard, but
it doesn't delete the selection (but at least there is no error dialog, so I'm
happy!).  This must be a different bug.

!SESSION Jun 12, 2004 20:24:42.268 ---------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=I200406111814
java.version=1.4.2_01
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments: -showlocation

Comment #2 is a duplicate of bug 66430.

Comment #4 sounds like a duplicate of bug 65975.

As for the original bug reported here, LogView.copyToClipboard must check that 
the length of textVersion is greater than 0 before setting the text in the 
clipboard.  Rerouting to PDE Core - I think they own LogView 
(org.eclipse.pde.internal.runtime)?

Fixing as per Veronika's suggestion in comment #5 has non-existent risk.
Dejan, +1 for RC3?
Verified there is no error on I20040617-0800.
